channel.title: One Man's Adventure to Become a Ninja.
channel.description: One Man's Adventure to Become a Ninja.

item.title: Become The Shadow
item.description:
Become The Shadow

One Man's Adventure to Become a Ninja

item.title: UNDERSTANDING “RADICAL” ISLAM
item.description:
UNDERSTANDING “RADICAL” ISLAM

Can Islam be saved from the radicals who now seem to be in charge? Well, if you won’t read the books I highlight here, then through your apathy Islam is probably beyond salvation.

item.title: Building skill | Happobiken
item.description:
Building skill | Happobiken

Most people would agree that skill is the ability to do something with a degree of proficiency. The more proficiently you can do the thing, the more skilful you are at that thing.

item.title: Budo Isn't Life
item.description:
Budo Isn't Life

I was reading an article about a writer who became a carpenter , but didn't stop writing, and it made me think about the mistake I sometimes see people make with budo. Budo is a Way, and as ways go, I think it is a great one.

item.title: Good Budo Is Simple. That Doesn't Mean It's Easy.
item.description:
Good Budo Is Simple. That Doesn't Mean It's Easy.

I had a conversation with one of my Shinto Muso Ryu students that was interesting. He was having a common issue with a core technique. He was trying to make the technique unnecessarily complicated. The technique (in this case Maki Otoshi) is difficult enough without making it complicated. Good budo is simple.

item.title: Why Are You In The Dojo?
item.description:
Why Are You In The Dojo?

I had my technique ripped to shreds by a teacher the other day. He pointed out every little mistake, and he wasn't the least bit gentle. There were no attempts to soften any criticism or to protect my ego. This was the epitome of "in your face" instruction.

item.title: Hatsumi Sensei Expands Into A Ninpo Type Feeling
item.description:
Hatsumi Sensei Expands Into A Ninpo Type Feeling

flower across from the pillar of Kyōbashi. Photo by Michael Glenn Next week I will travel again to Japan for Bujinkan training. My 3rd time this year. That may seem excessive, but the experiences I enjoy each trip help me discover the "secrets" of our art. For example, here is a lesson from Hatsumi...

item.title: THE ART OF UKE
item.description:
THE ART OF UKE

Being a good uke helps your partner. And there is an art to being a good uke. Last time I talked about the importance of proper attacks. This time I am going into more detail on the ways of doing proper attacks.

item.title: THE HUMBLE ART OF BEING UKE
item.description:
THE HUMBLE ART OF BEING UKE 

Being on the receiving end of a technique is seen as a chore. That is too limited a view. Being uke is a growth experience if you know how. And sometimes a good uke can be just as important as a good teacher.
